tool_description: Creates a new DNS zone for a domain with basic default records and configures zone settings for a specified DNS provider.

domain_name.description: Domain name for which to create the DNS zone

dns_provider.description: DNS service provider (cloudflare, route53, cloudns, etc.)

default_ttl.description: Default TTL for DNS records in seconds (300-86400)

create_defaults.description: Create default A, AAAA, and MX records

error_messages: Invalid domain format: Domain name must be a valid fully qualified domain name.
Unsupported DNS provider: The specified DNS provider is not supported.
TTL out of range: TTL must be between 300 and 86400 seconds.
Zone already exists: A DNS zone for this domain already exists with the provider.
DNS provider authentication failed: Unable to authenticate with the DNS service provider.
usage: Provide the domain name and DNS provider. Optionally set the default TTL and whether to create default records. The tool will create a new DNS zone and return zone configuration details.

zone_id.description: Unique zone identifier from the DNS provider

default_records_created.description: List of default DNS records created
